issue.title: Colouring history items

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Some requests are more relevant than others, so having the ability to mark these in the history view by adding color to lines would help in analyzing more complex flows like complex login processes, features that require two-factor authentication, or flows that pass tokens to different services.

The minimal feature would be selecting a set consecutive of requests, and the select from the context menu `Colour -> blue (in blue?)`. A selection of a few colours (maybe matching the RSyntaxTextArea ones) would enable the user to use some personal colour coding for the messy parts of manual testing.

Enhancements to this feature could be colouring entries based on regular expressions, contexts, or some other rules, a bit like like [rules in wireshark](https://www.wireshark.org/docs/wsug_html_chunked/ChCustColorizationSection.html). Also being able to set the colour of histroy entries in scripts could be a nice addition. 

https://mozilla.logbot.info/websectools/20171101#c13791537

issue.title: Ability to track HTTP requests based on client IP address

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Hi

I am using ZAP as a proxy to test an application from different computers. I am facing the problem that i dont know which request is coming from which computer

A nice enhancement would be to assign a tracker or a tag to those requests (and create the relevant API method to retrieve it) to be able to identify (and filter) which requests are coming from which computer

issue.title: Allow ZAP to listen on multiple addresses/ports

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Fixes #3983 

Note that this doesnt yet allow scripts to work out which proxy a request come from - thats planned as a later change.

body: This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
